ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, it is challenging but very rewarding.

Egyptology 571 01 is a course in the Diachronics of Egyptian Grammar, meaning that it examines the way grammatical forms change over time, and the reasons behind these changes. In many ways, however, it establishes the remarkable consistency of forms over time.

I would strongly recommend taking this course, as it changes the way you read and refer to Egyptian Grammar, and I believe it to be an essential course for every student in the field. Nevertheless, this course requires knowledge of the different levels of Egyptian before hand, and especially Coptic.
Absolutely. The course exposes students to a wide variety of scholarship in linguistics.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course helped solidfy my understanding of how these important languages change over time, but more importantly, the ways in which they didn't. This is vital to my profession as understanding the progression of language helps understand reasons behind changes in text.
I believe that now I morecapable in reading about Egyptian Grammar, and I think I am more careful when using terms and distinctions regarding this field.
